page.title: 01TOURIST GUIDE TO LANREATH
page.content: As you approach the village,the hedges jump out at you.There are many different flowers in them.You can see down the main street with cottages each side and get a glimpse of the church tower.On your left is the 200 hundred year old{Post Office}building. Look to your right and see{Churchtown with its granite posts.There are new bungalows now on the old Rectory gardens.Further down is the new Post Office/shop and the{ Museum,}a stone building,which was a tithe barn.The {Punch Bowl Inn}was a coaching inn.There is a fine{church, built in the 12th Century,straight ahead of you{.Court Barton,}built in Elizabethan times was the Manor House. There is a new estate round the corner,near the Chapel.The village is surrounded by countryside and farmland.
